thread.title: Pro Football Focus previews Seattle Seahawks-Detroit Lions game
thread.title_full: Pro Football Focus previews Seattle Seahawks-Detroit Lions game | The Seattle Times

author: Bob Condotta
title: Pro Football Focus previews Seattle Seahawks-Detroit Lions game
text:
Her is the weekly batch of links and stats from Pro Football Focus. 
Content: 
Cris Collinsworth gives three reasons on why the Legion of Boom is back (video clip).
NFL QB top 10 rankings (Russell Wilson is 10 th ).
Most Read Stories At least 9 killed in Roseburg, Ore., college shooting; gunman dead Parents of toddler killed in Bellevue to return to India Former Seattle Times building now home to thieves, squatters Police locate suspect vehicle in Wednesday's fatal parking-lot dispute Seahawks injuries: Marshawn Lynch may be gametime decision Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. NFL power ratings (Seahawks rank 6 th ).
Grade recaps from the Week 3 Seahawks and Lions games.
Signature Stats: 
— Lions’ QB Matthew Stafford is struggling this year and his 37.8% yards in air rate on his passes is fourth-lowest. He’s been hit four times in the process of throwing, second-most only to Cam Newton’s five.
— Both Wilson and Stafford are top-10 in pressure rate. As mentioned last week regarding accuracy under pressure, Wilson’s 81.5% accuracy ranks third after three weeks while Stafford’s 50.0 is fourth-worst.
— Calvin Johnson’s yards/route run has precipitously dropped from 2.29 (12 th ) to 1.45 (47 th ). Ex-Seahawks Golden Tate has seen a similar trend with his YPRR dropping from 2.13 (16 th ) to 1.24 (58 th ).
— Doug Baldwin has a 94.1 catch rate when lining up in the slot. He’s run 89 routes from the slot, and has been targeted 17 times, catching all but one of them.
— Lions offensive line has the second-worst pass block efficiency rating at 71.4. They’ve allowed 51 QB pressures, the most through three weeks for any team. The Seahawks aren’t that great either though, still in the bottom-third at 26 th .
— Seattle’s defense against running backs has steadily improved since the start of the season. Their HB elusive rating against has dropped from 58.3, to 34.7, to 9.1. Not a good thing for Lions HBs Ameer Abdullah and Joique Bell—their elusive ratings are 14.8 and 12.0, respectively. Of backs who’ve played at least 25% of snaps, those rank 43 rd and 47 th (out of 53).
Bob Condotta : 206-515-5699 or bcondotta@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @bobcondotta . Bob Condotta covers the Seahawks for the Seattle Times. He provides daily coverage of the team throughout the year.
